x10.matrix.sparse

Class CompressArray

  • x10.matrix.sparse.CompressArray

  • public class CompressArray
    Stores n elements, A(a1)=v1, ..., A(in)=an, where the indices are not necessarily adjacent, but must be distinct and in increasing order.

    The indices ai are called surface indices. The entries are stored contiguously in an array called the underlying array. Indices into the underlying array are called underlying indices.

        make
        

        public static CompressArray make(x10.lang.Int sz)
        

        Declaration: make(sz:x10.lang.Int): x10.matrix.sparse.CompressArray{self!=null}.
        Make a compressed array.
        

        Parameters:
        sz - Number of entries or underlying indices.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        init
        

        protected x10.lang.Int init(x10.lang.Int offset,
                x10.lang.Int maxIndex,
                x10.lang. Fun_0_2<x10.lang.Int,x10.util.Random,x10.lang.Double> init,
                x10.lang.Double nzd)
        

        Declaration: init(offset:x10.lang.Int,maxIndex:x10.lang.Int,init:(x10.lang.Int,x10.util.Random)=>x10.lang.Double,nzd:x10.lang.Double): x10.lang.Int.
        Compress array data initialization. Starting from offset in the
underlying array, set data in the compress array upto the last underlying
indices with indices.  The surface indices values are between 0 and
maxIndex-1.  Each element of the matrix is tested.  An entry is added only if
a generated random number is below nzd. init is called
with the index of the underlying array and a random number
generator. The resulting value is used to initialize the entry.
        

        Parameters:
        offset - Offset for the beginning index of the array
        maxIndex - The maximum surface index created.
        init(ci,rg) - The data initialization function, mapping ci to
                      a value using random rg.
        nzd - Percentage of nonzero entries or sparsity
        

        Returns:
        number of non-zero added

                x10.lang.Double nzd)
        

        Declaration: init(offset:x10.lang.Int,sttIndex:x10.lang.Int,maxIndex:x10.lang.Int,init:(x10.lang.Int,x10.util.Random)=>x10.lang.Double,nzd:x10.lang.Double): x10.lang.Int.

        initConstValue
        

        public x10.lang.Int initConstValue(x10.lang.Int offset,
                          x10.lang.Int maxIndex,
                          x10.lang.Double v,
                          x10.lang.Double nzd)
        

        Initialize compress array with a constant values.  This method is used
for testing purpose.
Distance between two adjacent surface indices is randomly created
in normal distribution
        

        Parameters:
        offset - the starting index in the storage.
        maxIndex - the maximum surface index
        nzd - nonzero density
        return - number of nonzeros added

        init
        

        public x10.lang.Int init(x10.lang.Int offset,
                x10.lang.Int maxIndex,
                x10.lang. Fun_0_1<x10.lang.Int,x10.lang.Int> fidx,
                x10.lang. Fun_0_1<x10.lang.Int,x10.lang.Double> fval)
        

        Declaration: init(offset:x10.lang.Int,maxIndex:x10.lang.Int,fidx:(x10.lang.Int)=>x10.lang.Int,fval:(x10.lang.Int)=>x10.lang.Double): x10.lang.Int.
        Initialize compress array using nonzero indexing generating function and value
generating function.
        

        Parameters:
        offset - the starting position in the storage
        maxIndex - the maximum surface index
        fidx - the indexing function, given [0..maxIndex) range. Must be ascending.
        fval - nonzero value generating function given [0..maxIndex) range If zero, ignored.
        

        Returns:
        number of nonzero values

        initRandom
        

        public x10.lang.Int initRandom(x10.lang.Int offset,
                      x10.lang.Int maxIndex,
                      x10.lang.Double nzd)
        

        Initialize compress array with random values.  This method is used
for testing and performancing benchmark.
Distance between two adjacent surface indices is randomly created
in normal distribution
        

        Parameters:
        offset - the starting index in the storage.
        maxIndex - the maximum surface index
        nzd - nonzero density
        return - number of non-zeros added

        initRandomFast
        

        public x10.lang.Int initRandomFast(x10.lang.Int offset,
                          x10.lang.Int maxIndex,
                          x10.lang.Double nzd,
                          x10.lang.Int lb,
                          x10.lang.Int ub)
        

        Fast initialize method. Distance between two adjacent surface indices is randomly created
in uniform distribution.  This method is used for testing and performance
benchmark.
        

        Parameters:
        offset - -- Offset of starting position
        maxIndex - -- Maximum index for all entries
        nzd - -- Nonzero percentage for each entry, must >= 1.0
        lb - -- lower random value bound
        ub - -- upper random value bound
        return - -- number of nonzeros added

to ensure that the v.first >=0, and after this update the
compressed array satisfies its invariants.

        storageSize
        

        public x10.lang.Int storageSize()
        

        The number of entries allocated for this compressed array.
May be nonzero even if the compressed array has zero elements.
storageSize() must be less than Int.MAX_VALUE.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        find
        

        public x10.lang.Int find(x10.lang.Int idx,
                x10.lang.Int start,
                x10.lang.Int end)
        

        Search between start and end for the index i that is mapped
to the surface index idx.  If such an index does not exist
then return the index in the backing array for a value within
the range that is no smaller than idx.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        find
        

        public x10.lang.Double find(x10.lang.Int idx)
        

        Return the value associated with index idx for this array,
and 0.0 if the array does not have a value for idx.

        copyRange
        

        public void copyRange(x10.lang.Int srcOffset,
             x10.lang.Int length,
             x10.lang.Int dstOffset,
             x10.lang.Int base,
             CompressArray dest)
        

        obsolete
Copy length entries from the compressed array, starting from srcOffset
into dest starting at destOffset. The surface index of the entry in the
destination compressed array is less than the surface index of
the entry in the source array.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        copy
        

        public static void copy(CompressArray src,
        x10.lang.Int srcoff,
        CompressArray dst,
        x10.lang.Int dstoff,
        x10.lang.Int len,
        x10.lang.Int idxchg)
        

        Copy specified range of compressed array from source to target.  The target compress
array allows to specify the modification for its index values, allowing target compress array
s
has different original size (uncompress data array size) from the source.
        

        Parameters:
        src - The source compress array
        srcoff - The starting position of source compress array
        dst - The target compress array
        dstoff - The starting position of target compress array
        len - The number of elements (index-value pair) to be copied
        idxchg - Modification on the index values in the target compress array
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        copy
        

        public static void copy(CompressArray src,
        x10.lang.Int srcoff,
        CompressArray dst,
        x10.lang.Int dstoff,
        x10.lang.Int len)
        

        Copy specified range of compress array from source to target. No index modification.
If destination storage limit is reached, a new storage will be
allocated and previous data will be copied to the new storage.
        

        Parameters:
        src - The source compress array
        srcoff - The starting position of source compress array
        dst - The target compress array
        dstoff - The starting position of target compress array
        len - The number of elements (index-value pair) to be copied

        countNonZero
        

        public static x10.lang.Int countNonZero(x10.array.Array<x10.lang.Double> d)
        

        Declaration: countNonZero(d:x10.array.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1}): x10.lang.Int.
        Return the number of nonzero (nz) entries in the given array.
An entry v is nz if Math.testZero(v) succeeds.

        compressAt
        

        public x10.lang.Int compressAt(x10.lang.Int destOffset,
                      x10.array.Array<x10.lang.Double> s)
        

        Declaration: compressAt(destOffset:x10.lang.Int,s:x10.array.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1}): x10.lang.Int.
        Transfer as many nz entries from d into this
the as can fit into this. The entries are transferred
into the destination starting from offset.
Note: For the invariant of the dest compressed array to
be satisfied, the compressed array should be empty, since
the index of the first element transferred is going to be zero.,
        

        Parameters:
        offset - the index of the first entry in dest into which to copy
        

        Returns:
        number of nz entries transferred

        extract
        

        public void extract(x10.lang.Int srcOffset,
           x10.lang.Int count,
           x10.lang.Int dstOffset,
           x10.array.Array<x10.lang.Double> dest)
        

        Declaration: extract(srcOffset:x10.lang.Int,count:x10.lang.Int,dstOffset:x10.lang.Int,dest:x10.array.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1}): void.
        Extract data from this compressed array and transfer into dest.
Start from the srcOffset index in the underlying array, and
transfer at most count entries. In the destination, copy these
entries after destOffset. All data in destination array will be overwritten.
        

        Parameters:
        srcOffset - starting offset of source compress array
        count - number of nonzero to extract from compress array
        dstOffset - starting offset for target array to store the extracted data
        dest - target array

        x10$matrix$sparse$CompressArray$$this$x10$matrix$sparse$CompressArray
        

        public final CompressArray x10$matrix$sparse$CompressArray$$this$x10$matrix$sparse$CompressArray()
        

        Declaration: x10$matrix$sparse$CompressArray$$this$x10$matrix$sparse$CompressArray(): x10.matrix.sparse.CompressArray{self==this(:x10.matrix.sparse.CompressArray)}.
        Stores n elements, A(a1)=v1, ..., A(in)=an,
where the indices are not necessarily adjacent, but
must be distinct and in increasing order.


         The indices ai are called surface indices. The entries
are stored contiguously in an array called the underlying array.
Indices into the underlying array are called underlying indices.
